brief_summary.textblock:
This study is to prove that there is no difference in the number of healthy male volunteers
      that will experience pyrexia (i.e. fever with body temperature of 38°C or higher) within a
      24 hour period after administration of a single dose of 6mg/kg of PF-05280014 or trastuzumab
      sourced from the United States (trastuzumab-US).  The study will also compare the safety of
      both drugs.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Evaluating The Safety Of PF-05280014 And Trastuzumab In Healthy Male Volunteers (REFLECTIONS B327-06)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Body Mass Index (BMI) of 17.5 to 30.5 kg^m2; and a total body weight >50 kg (110
             lbs).

          -  Left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) within the normal range as measured by
             echocardiogram (ECHO) within 8 weeks prior to randomization.

          -  Subjects who have previously been exposed to a biologic agent (other than a HER2
             inhibitor) may enroll provided that at least 3 months have passed since the last
             administration of that drug.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Evidence or history of clinically significant hematological, renal, endocrine,
             pulmonary, gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, hepatic, psychiatric, neurologic, or
             allergic disease (including drug allergies, but excluding untreated, asymptomatic,
             seasonal allergies at time of dosing).

          -  Previous exposure to an anti-HER2 antibody.

          -  History of serious allergic or anaphylactic reaction to a therapeutic drug or benzyl
             alcohol.

intervention.description: Concentrate for solution for infusion, sterile vial 150 mg, single-dose 6 mg/kg administered as 90-minute infusion on Day 1
Concentrate for solution for infusion, sterile vial 440 mg, single-dose 6 mg/kg administered as 90-minute infusion on Day 1

clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Double-Blind, Randomized, Parallel-Group, Single-Dose, 2-Arm, Safety Study Of PF-05280014 And Trastuzumab Sourced From The US Administered To Healthy Male Volunteers

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of body temperature greater than or equal to 38.0 degrees Celsius

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Relationship of study therapy to pyrexia
Incidence of body temperature greater than or equal to 38.0°C and/or use of concomitant treatment associated with fever suppression

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator)
